SEARCH
Package pegasus.grid

Interface Grid<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of object this grid is to hold
All Superinterfaces:
BaseGrid<T>, BinaryIndexedIterable<T>, Iterable<T>, Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
AtomicGrid<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ArrayGrid, AtomicArrayGrid
public interface Grid<T> extends BaseGrid<T>, BinaryIndexedIterable<T>
A reference-based generic grid.
See Also:
  • BaseGrid
  • ArrayGrid
  • AtomicGrid

      static <T> Grid<T> of(T[][] values)
      Creates a new grid containing the provided values.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of object to contain
      Parameters:
      values - The rectangular array of values
      Returns:
      The constructed grid
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the array is not rectangular
      NullPointerException - When the array contains a null row

    • fillRange

      void fillRange(int r1, int c1, int r2, int c2, Grid<? extends T> g) throws BinaryIndexOutOfBoundsException
      Fills a sub-portion of this grid with the values of the provided grid g.
      Parameters:
      r1 - The starting row index (inclusive)
      c1 - The starting column index (inclusive)
      r2 - The ending row index (exclusive)
      c2 - The ending column index (exclusive)
      g - The source grid of which to retrieve elements from
      Throws:
      BinaryIndexOutOfBoundsException - When the range is invalid, or is out of bounds
      NullPointerException - When the provided grid g is null

    • merge

      <U, V> Grid<V> merge(Grid<U> g, BiFunction<? super T,? super U,? extends V> merger) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException
      Applies the provided merger function to each corresponding pair of elements between this grid and the provided grid g, then returns a new grid whose elements are populated from that of the return values of the provided merger function.
      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of element to merge this grid with
      V - The type of element to merge the grids to
      Parameters:
      g - The grid of which to merge this grid with
      merger - The merger function of which to handle the merging of the two grids
      Returns:
      The resulting grid
      Throws:
      IncompatibleDimensionsException - When the grids' dimensions are different
      NullPointerException - When either the provided grid g or the merger function is null

    • resize

      Grid<T> resize(int rows, int columns)
      Returns a new grid with the provided dimensions whose elements are populated from that of this grid's elements, trimmed or padded with null values as necessary.
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows to resize to
      columns - The number of columns to resize to
      Returns:
      The resized grid
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the dimensions produce negative area
